thread.title: Bullis QB Haskins Jr. reaffirms commitment to MD

title: Bullis QB Haskins Jr. reaffirms commitment to MD
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Bullis QB Haskins Jr. reaffirms commitment to MD Despite the rumors surrounding Randy Edsall's job security, MD verbal commit Dwayne Haskins Jr. reaffirmed his commitment to the Terps on Thursday Post to Facebook Bullis QB Haskins Jr. reaffirms commitment to MD Despite the rumors surrounding Randy Edsall's job security, MD verbal commit Dwayne Haskins Jr. reaffirmed his commitment to the Terps on Thursday  //on.wusa9.com/1LkY25M   Join the Conversation To   Bullis QB Haskins Jr. reaffirms commitment to MD Grace E Olson, Sam C. LaPaille and WUSA 9 Staff, WUSA 9:29 p.m. EDT October 8, 2015 Dwayne Haskins Jr. sat down with Grace Olson on Thursday, confirming his plans on attending the University of Maryland despite the rumors surrounding HC Randy Edsall. (Photo: WUSA9) 1 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
POTOMAC, Md. (WUSA9) -- Despite the rumors surrounding current Maryland football coach Randy Edsall and his job security, star Bullis QB and Maryland verbal commit Dwayne Haskins Jr. delivered a strong message on Thursday, reassuring his commitment to Maryland . Star Bullis QB Dwayne Haskins showed serious maturity by reaffirming his commitment to MD despite the Randy Edsall rumors, says he chose school "for more than just for football." 
Throughout the interview, Haskins Jr. noted that he wants to be a part of Maryland for more reasons other than football. 
Haskins Jr. also took to Twitter to share his feelings on being a future Terp. Committed to the state. They need us üê¢ ‚Äî Dwayne Haskins, Jr‚ôö‚Ñ¢ (@dh_simba7) October 8, 2015 
The 6'3", 200 pound Haskins is ranked the sixth-best pro-style quarterback prospect in the country according to 247sports .
